answers.answer: We're you tested for gestational diabetes during the 28the week? Technically you've only gained 24 lbs so far.. seems to be the appropriate gain. As long as your Dr isn't worried
@Sass508 thank you for responding! No gestational diabetes thank God, it just ***** because I've never been this big in my life, my body doesn't seem to know how to handle it..
I'm sure if your OB had seen a risk he would have sent you to the perinatal. Ask your oB to counsil you on your concerns also try seeing a nutritionist.
Just have to say that 188 is not extremely over weight:) I'm bigger then you and on our fourth baby I have never had any complications for being heavy or any other reason try not to stress
I was gonna say, I wish I was 188 right now.

I started out at 180, I've always been chunky.  And I've gained 40 pounds so far,  I'm 37 weeks.   My doctors aren't concerned because it's been a steady gradual gain, not all at once or anything.    I feel like crap  about it though.   :(

I feel your pain! I was ecgteneky heavy with my first. Around 222 at my heaviest. Now with my second I was 158 and already at 172 and I'm only 9 weeks!!! Its scary from going to being fit and finally happy with my body to feeling fat and bloated. But I know tha I'm carrying a child and it will come off when I have him/her. Hang in there!

question: Hi moms, back in 2013 I was 128lbs before giving birth to my twins in Dec topping out at 186 lbs, after breastfeeding I went down to 164lbs. I'm now currently 33weeks with my 3rd child and 188lbs, my heart seems to be pounding a lot faster and breathing is getting tougher, are there any potential risks for being extremely overweight during pregnancy??...
title: 33 weeks and really overweight extremely worried
